results.title: Funny face
results.creator_credit: Stanley Donen, Roger Edens and Paramount Pictures
results.brief_description: Fred Astaire stars as a fashion photographer looking for a new face to promote Kay Thompson’s fashion magazine. He discovers Audrey Hepburn working in a bookstore and transforms her into a model on the cover of the “Vogue-like” magazine. Shot on location in Paris and featuring songs by George and Ira Gershwin, “Funny face” is a song and dance delight, with romantic backdrops. Hepburn in her Givency clothes is stunning.

results.title: Harvesting
results.creator_credit: Arthur Lamothe, Guy L. Cote, Marcel Martin and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A visual poem about the wheat harvest on the vast Canadian prairies. Here, reality is horizon-wide fields of grain that must be cut and threshed by the combines before frost lays the crop to waste. The images suggest a strange but magnificent military maneuver as a phalanx of giant machines lumbers across the golden acres.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Arthur Lamothe, Guy L. Cote, Marcel Martin and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: La Spagnola
results.creator_credit: Steve Jacobs, Anna-Maria Monticelli, Australian Film Commission, SBS Independent and Wild Strawberries
results.brief_description: Directed by Steve Jacobs and set in 1960, “La Spagnola” is one family’s story of the migrant experience in Australia. Lola (Lola Marceli) is a beautiful, tempestuous Spanish woman living in a remote industrial town with her boorish husband, Ricardo (Simon Palomares), and their teenage daughter, Lucia (Alice Ansara). When Ricardo decides to leave her for his Australian mistress, Lola is left destitute and pregnant turns violent and vengeful. Her daughter, sensitive, lonely, mocked at school, and confused by her mother’s anger toward her, seeks refuge in an aunt and tries to reconcile with her absent father. Lola is driven by a quest for revenge against the two who have robbed her of her only security in a strange land. Lola and Lucia, each striking out hatefully at the other, are on a collision course, plotting their separate plans for vengeance. Also starring Alex Dimitriades as a local playboy, romantically interested in both mother and daughter. Mostly in Spanish, with Italian and English, and with English subtitles.

results.title: Industrial symphony no. 1: dream of the broken hearted
results.creator_credit: David Lynch, Angelo Badalamenti and Elbow Music
results.brief_description: Video of a performance featuring Julee Cruise singing the music of David Lynch and Angelo Badalamenti. The theme of the performance is the dreams a woman experiences after the man she loves leaves her. Julee Cruise portrays the woman in her dreams. Also stars Laura Dern and Nicolas Cage.

results.title: Next door
results.brief_description: Based on a Kurt Vonnegut Jr story. A young boy left home alone while his parents attend a movie overhears an argument bvetween the couple in the house next door. The boy, becoming increasingly disturbed by the dispute, intervenes in an unusual way. Starring James Wood as the father of the young boy.

results.title: Honeymoon in Vegas (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Andrew Bergman, Mike Lobell, Castle Rock Entertainment and New Line Cinema
results.brief_description: Nicholas Cage is Jack Singer, a second-rate private eye who has somehow managed to win the undying love of gorgeous school teacher, Betsy Nolan (Sarah Jessica Parker). Now, after 5 years Betsy wants a commitment, but Jack is plagued by his mother’s deathbed wish that he never marry. In an irrational moment Jack relents and they travel to Vegas to exchange their vows, and this is where the trouble begins. Featuring James Caan as a wealthy, evil card-shark and a cast including several-hundred Elvis impersonators, it’s a hunka hunka burnin’ fun!

results.title: Nasty love = L'Amore molesto
results.creator_credit: Mario Martone, Andrea Occhipinti, Angelo Curti, Kermit Smith, Lucky Red and Teatri Uniti
results.brief_description: A woman goes to investigate her mother’s apparent suicide and ends up having to face the grim reality of her past. Amalia, the sixty-something mother of Delia, is found dead on the beach, when she should have been on her way to visit Delia in Bologna. Delia, wanting to know why her mother killed herself, journeys back to Naples to discover the truth. She encounters her mother’s supposed lover and his son, as well as her estranged father. As she continues to explore, she must face the fact that her relationship with her mother was based on jealousy and disgust as much as it was on love. She must also face up to a terrible lie she told as a child, one that questioned her mother’s fidelity and ruined the lives of everyone around her. In Italian with English subtitles. Cast includes Anna Bonaiuto, Angela Luce, Gianni Cajafa and Giovanni Viglietti.

results.title: Gribouille = Heart of Paris
results.creator_credit: Marc Allegret, Andre Daven and Roger Le Bon
results.brief_description:
Camille Moresteau is serving on a jury in a murder trial. Moresteau takes pity on Nathalie Rougin and invites her to move in with his family for the duration of the trial. Moresteau’s son Claude takes an immediate interest in Nathalie while suspecting his father to have views on the young woman. Sensing her presence is causing tension in the family, Nathalie prepares to leave but not before she has stolen some valuables from the Moresteaus. The film was remade as ‘The Lady in question’ in 1940 by Charles Vidor.

Credits: Producers, Andre Daven, Roger Le Bon ; director, Marc Allegret ; writer, Marcel Achard, H. G. Lustig ; photography, Armand Thirard, G. Benoit, Michel Kelber ; music, Georges Auric ; art direction, Alexandre Trauner.
Cast: Raimu, Michele Morgan, Pauline Carton, Gilbert Gil, Jacqueline Pacaud, Julien Carette, Jean Worms, Bernard Blier, Jacques Baumer, Andrex.

results.title: Hilary and Jackie
results.creator_credit: Anand Tucker, Andy Paterson, Nicolas Kent and Oxford Film Company
results.brief_description: This is the story of two gifted sisters who grew up in England in the 1950s and competed for musical accolade and love. Hilary was a talented flautist, but it was her sister, Jackie, who was the musical genius who went on to become one of the greatest cellists of the 20th century, while Hilary chose a simple family life in the country. The film follows their sibling rivalry in musical competition and romance, and in spite of their differences they both share common emotions, including jealousy. As Jackie struggles with her rapid rise to fame, her journey would have incredible and devastating consequences on both hers and Hilary’s lives. Cast includes Emily Watson, Rachel Griffiths, James Frain and David Morrissey.
